priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Trial Blinding Schema Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66735

self.title: CDISC SDTM Trial Blinding Schema Terminology

definition: A terminology codelist relevant to the type of blinding for the trial.
name: Trial Blinding Schema Response
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Trial Blinding Schema Terminology

terms.definition: A study in which neither the subject nor the study personnel interacting with the subject or data during the study knows what intervention a subject is receiving.

A study in which the study personnel who measure, record, or assess the subject do not know which intervention the subject is receiving or, in the context of observational studies, do not know the external factors to which a subject has been exposed.
A study in which the therapeutic treatment is open label but the dosing information of the investigational medicinal product (IMP) is double-blinded.
terms.preferredTerm: Open Label for Treatment And Double Blind to Dose
terms.submissionValue: OPEN LABEL TO TREATMENT AND DOUBLE BLIND TO IMP DOSE

terms.definition: A study in which subjects and study personnel know which intervention each subject is receiving.
A study in which one party, either the subject or study personnel, does not know which intervention is administered to the subject.
